Title: Was In Talks With Gandhis For Almost 2 Years: Prashant Kishor To NDTV
Date: Edited by Divyanshu Dutta Roy  | Monday January 24, 2022, New Delhi
Summary: Election strategist Prashant Kishor on Monday said that his talks to team up with the Congress fell through after nearly five months of discussions following the West Bengal elections, and although the party remains vital to defeat the BJP on a natio

Title: Jailed MP Azam Khan, Son, On Samajwadi Party List In UP
Date: Written by Alok Pandey  | Monday January 24, 2022, Lucknow
Summary: Jailed Samajwadi Party MP Azam Khan will contest the upcoming assembly election in Uttar Pradesh from his home turf Rampur, the Samajwadi Party announced today.

Title: "I Only Quoted General Bipin Rawat On Pak": Akhilesh Yadav To NDTV
Date: Reported by Saurabh Shukla | Monday January 24, 2022, New Delhi
Summary: Akhilesh Yadav today defended his comment that China is the real enemy while Pakistan is only the "political enemy" targeted by the BJP for votes and referenced General Bipin Rawat, the Chief of Defence Staff, who died in a helicopter crash on Dec 8.

Title: Karnataka Infant Among 14 In World With Rare Genetic Disorder BENTA
Date: Press Trust of India   | Monday January 24, 2022, Bangaluru
Summary: A seven-month-old baby from Bengaluru has been diagnosed with the 'BENTA' disease, an extremely rare primary immunodeficiency disorder, that is said to have affected only 13 others in the world.

Title: Delhi Positivity Rate Falls To 11.79% From 13%; Cases Down 37% To 5,760
Date: Edited by Swati Bhasin  | Monday January 24, 2022, New Delhi
Summary: Delhi saw a significant drop in daily cases with 5,760 fresh infections, 37 per cent lower than yesterday (9,197). The positivity rate fell to 11.79 per cent from 13.3 per cent.

Title: Two Secret Tunnels By Pakistan Detected, 6 Intruders Killed In 2021: BSF
Date: Press Trust of India   | Monday January 24, 2022, Jammu
Summary: The Border Security Force (BSF) troops neutralized six intruders and apprehended three while trying to infiltrate through the India-Pakistan border last year, officials said on Monday.

Title: Congress Asks Maharashtra Chief Minister To Stop Release Of Movie 'Why I Killed Gandhi'
Date: Press Trust of India   | Monday January 24, 2022, Mumbai
Summary: The Congress on Monday appealed to Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray to stop the upcoming telecast of the movie 'Why I killed Gandhi' on January 30, saying it will strengthen racist tendencies.

Title: In Big Setback, Sikkim's Key Opposition Party Sees Over 40 Exits In A Day
Date: Written by Ratnadip Choudhury  | Monday January 24, 2022, Gangtok
Summary: In a major setback to the Sikkim Democratic Front (SDF), the key opposition party in the northeastern state, and its head and former Chief Minister Pawan Kumar Chamling, 42 party leaders, including Vice President Ganesh Rai, today submitted their res

Title: BJP Failed To Keep Poll Promises: Bengal Actor Bonny Sengupta Quits Party
Date: Press Trust of India   | Monday January 24, 2022, Kolkata
Summary: Bengali actor Bonny Sengupta, who had joined the BJP ahead of the Assembly polls last year, today said he is quitting the party as it failed to keep the promises of development of the state and the film industry.

Title: Sonia Gandhi, Manmohan Singh Among Congress Star Campaigners For UP Polls
Date: Asian News International   | Monday January 24, 2022, New Delhi
Summary: The Congress party on Monday released a list of 30-star campaigners for the first phase of the Uttar Pradesh assembly elections.

Title: Prashant Kishor To NDTV: Possible To Defeat BJP In 2024, But...
Date: Edited by Divyanshu Dutta Roy  | Monday January 24, 2022, New Delhi
Summary: Election strategist Prashant Kishor on Monday said he wanted to help form an opposition front that could defeat the BJP in 2024 and that it was "entirely possible" even if results of next month's state polls - seen as a semi-final of sorts for the ge

Title: Granite Slabs To Help Raise Ayodhya Ram Temple Floor. See Pics
Date: Edited by Sumana Nandy  | Monday January 24, 2022, New Delhi
Summary: Work at the Ram Temple in Ayodhya is underway in full swing as workers today began placing blocks of granite on the raft built at the temple site.

Title: Pak PM Lobbied For "Old Friend" Navjot Sidhu: Amarinder Singh's Shocker
Date: Reported by Mohammed Ghazali, Edited by Anindita Sanyal  | Monday January 24, 2022, Chandigarh
Summary: Punjab's former Chief Minister Amarinder Singh's seat sharing announcement with the BJP today was accompanied by a shocker -- one about his arch-rival Navjot Sidhu and his old cricketing buddy, Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan.

Title: Opium, Not Opinion Polls, Says Akhilesh Yadav To NDTV
Date: Reported by Saurabh Shukla, Edited by Deepshikha Ghosh  | Monday January 24, 2022, Lucknow
Summary: Akhilesh Yadav today said surveys favouring the BJP in Uttar Pradesh ahead of elections next month were "opium polls, not opinion polls". He also called UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath the "biggest liar".

Title: Fraud, Scamster: Navjot Sidhu Targets Arvind Kejriwal Over Punjab Telepoll
Date: Edited by Anindita Sanyal  | Monday January 24, 2022, Chandigarh
Summary: Congress's Navjot Sidhu has accused Arvind Kejriwal of faking data while choosing Bhagwant Mann as his Aam Aadmi Party's Chief Ministerial face in Punjab. Tagging Mr Kejriwal a "scamster" at a press conference this afternoon,
